Text: None
Author: None

Text: ['The record jail sentence for the co-founder of Just Stop Oil could serve as a “rallying call” to other climate activists for a wave of protests, police believe.', 'Roger Hallam, 58, was jailed for five years on Thursday for orchestrating protests that disrupted the M25 over four days in November 2022 when 45 protesters climbed gantries on various parts of the motorway, forcing police to stop traffic.', 'Daniel Shaw, 38, Lucia Whittaker De Abreu, 35, Louise Lancaster, 58, and Cressida Gethin, 22, were each given four years after being found guilty along with Hallam of conspiracy to cause a public nuisance.', 'The sentences, handed down by Judge Christopher Hehir, are thought to be the longest ever given for peaceful protest and have been widely criticised.']
Author: ['Katie Gibbons', 'Matt Dathan']
Images_url: [['The sentences handed down to Lucia Whittaker De Abreu, Cressida Gethin, Louise Lancaster, Daniel Shaw and Hallam have been widely criticised', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F683cd313-fd5e-43a3-ac3d-4b0f65a0a2b5.jpg?crop=1116%2C744%2C230%2C156'], ['Roger Hallam was jailed for five years for orchestrating the M25 protests in 2022. It is thought to be the longest ever sentence to be handed down for peaceful protest', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F44ec9ad7-29df-4759-b5e8-e5121218ffdd.jpg?crop=4822%2C2712%2C0%2C88&resize=360']]

Text: ['A five-year jail sentence for the founder of Just Stop Oil has been welcomed by a minister, who hoped it would send a “strong message” to other activists.', 'Luke Pollard, the armed forces minister, condemned the “pathetic” and “highly dangerous” behaviour of the direct action group for blocking roads. He claimed that the group had held up ambulances responding to emergency callouts, arguing it had sparked a public backlash and “set the case back” for tackling climate change.', 'Pollard told LBC radio: “I’m glad that there’s now been a strong message sent to them, and anyone thinking about that type of disruptive protest in the future, that there’ll be serious consequences if they go down that path.”', 'He added that the “strong penalties” imposed by']
Author: ['Ali Mitib', 'Jonathan Ames', 'Aubrey Allegretti', 'Georgia Lambert']
Images_url: [['The activists, including Hallam, second from right, outside Southwark crown court before they were sentenced', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2Fd8687eba-2ab0-4f5c-802e-4f457c5cf390.jpg?crop=1024%2C707%2C0%2C61'], ['The sentences handed to Lucia Whittaker De Abreu, Cressida Gethin, Louise Lancaster, Daniel Shaw and Roger Hallam were condemned as a “gross miscarriage of justice”', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F683cd313-fd5e-43a3-ac3d-4b0f65a0a2b5.jpg?crop=993%2C559%2C299%2C224&resize=360']]

Text: ['As a young woman, few things worried Louise Lancaster more than the idea of letting people down or doing something embarrassing. Having been one of the co-organisers of the protest that reduced parts of the M25 to gridlock over four days in November 2022, it seems that in later life she managed to overcome those challenges.', '“For the woman I married to become the woman she is now, she’s had to go against the principles she was raised with,” says her former husband Tim Lancaster. “To get to the stage where she could face off a police officer and risk arrest … all of that was hard for her. Really hard. The fact she was going to inconvenience people was the most difficult part. She']
Author: ['Caroline Scott']
Images_url: [['The family of Just Stop Oil protester Louise Lancaster, from left: son Theo, Jonny Ainslie, fiancé to daughter Verity, ex-husband Tim, and son Tristan', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F0c3e8422-e565-4a22-baa8-11a8f0b19e54.jpg?crop=5000%2C2812%2C0%2C24&resize=360']]

Text: ['The record jail sentences handed down to five Just Stop Oil activists could prove a “massive trigger event” for further action by the climate movement, Roger Hallam has said in an interview from prison.', 'Hallam, 58, was jailed for five years this month for orchestrating protests that disrupted the M25 over four days in November 2022 when 45 protesters climbed gantries on various parts of the motorway, forcing police to stop traffic.', 'Daniel Shaw, 38, Lucia Whittaker De Abreu, 35, Louise Lancaster, 58, and Cressida Gethin, 22, were each given four years after also being found guilty of conspiracy to cause a public nuisance.', 'The sentences handed down by Judge Christopher Hehir are thought to be the longest ever given for peaceful protest and have']
Author: ['Tom Ball']
Images_url: [['Roger Hallam was jailed for five years for orchestrating protests that caused disruption', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F2245bcf1-43c8-4f87-8d30-13eb3f2c525a.jpg?crop=4000%2C2250%2C0%2C210&resize=360']]

Text: ['The co-founder of the Just Stop Oil movement, Roger Hallam, was jailed this month for five years. Judge Christopher Hehir gave four fellow activists four-year jail sentences after they were also found guilty of conspiracy to cause a public nuisance.', 'During four days in November 2022, the group disrupted the M25 when more than 45 protesters climbed gantries, forcing the police to stop traffic.', 'The judge said he was handing out exemplary sentences because of the seriousness of these offences and the risk that they would further escalate.', '• Prepare for jail, judge tells Just Stop Oil’s Van Gogh protesters', 'In an interview with The Times, Hallam gloated that the sentences would galvanise further protests. Whether that’s true or not, his attack on the']
Author: ['Melanie Phillips']
Images_url: [['author-image', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2Fa5b72fd2-2ed2-4bdc-9de1-d356562eaf8f.png?crop=300%2C300%2C0%2C0']]

Text: ['Whatever you think of Phoebe Plummer and Anna Holland’s decision to throw soup at one of the world’s most famous paintings, it is undeniable that their act of eco-protest has had an unusual cut-through.', 'The two Just Stop Oil activists are likely to be given jail terms in September after being found guilty of criminal damage for throwing the contents of two tins of tomato soup over Vincent van Gogh’s Sunflowers in the National Gallery in London.', 'When I met them a few days after the incident, which made headlines around the world in October 2022, they were far from contrite and planning further protests. And, perhaps because of Plummer’s pink hair, they were immediately recognisable.', 'As the two students left the café in southeast']
Author: ['Damian Whitworth']
Images_url: [['Puzzle thumbnail', 'https://www.thetimes.com/d/img/puzzles/new-illustrations/crossword-c7ae8934ef.png'], ['Puzzle thumbnail', 'https://www.thetimes.com/d/img/puzzles/new-illustrations/polygon-875ea55487.png'], ['Puzzle thumbnail', 'https://www.thetimes.com/d/img/puzzles/new-illustrations/sudoku-ee2aea0209.png'], ['The Just Stop Oil climate protesters Phoebe Plummer and Anna Holland, both 22', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F4ece7e96-9324-4a34-85e3-389aa32d68ca.jpg?crop=5000%2C2812%2C0%2C478&resize=360']]

Text: ['More than 1,100 lawyers, celebrities, academics and artists have called for an urgent meeting with the attorney-general to address the “injustice” of the sentences handed to five environmental activists for peaceful protest.', 'Roger Hallam, 58, was last week jailed for five years for co-ordinating the protest that disrupted the M25 in London over four days in 2022, during which 45 protesters climbed gantries on the motorway, forcing police to stop traffic. Daniel Shaw, 38, Lucia Whittaker de Abreu, 35, Louise Lancaster, 58, and Cressida Gethin, 22, were each given four years after being found guilty along with Hallam of conspiracy to cause a public nuisance.', 'The jail terms, handed down by Judge Christopher Hehir, exceed those given to two Just Stop Oil activists who scaled']
Author: ['Ali Mitib']
Images_url: [['The severity of the sentences given last week to five climate activists has raised concern and prompted further protest', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F7f8c1364-d461-4e69-8981-57288f24d906.jpg?crop=5000%2C2813%2C0%2C260&resize=360']]

Text: ['Thousands of Extinction Rebellion protesters will stage a mass occupation of Windsor Great Park in a direct challenge to the King for three days next month.', 'The occupation will take place from August 30 until September 1 in the grounds of Windsor Castle in Berkshire, XR announced.', 'Quoting Harmony, a book the King wrote while still the Prince of Wales, the protest group said Charles “clearly understands the plight of the planet and the urgent need for society to change course”.', 'The group acknowledged that the King is expected to be less vocal about climate change and environmental destruction now that he is the reigning monarch as it is seen as “too political”.', 'Although they insisted the occupation will not be targeting a person']
Author: ['Seren Hughes']
Images_url: [['The occupation will take place from August 30 until September 1 in the grounds of Windsor Castle in Berkshire', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2Fbbb1e277-eae4-414c-b810-ac0732b59bc9.jpg?crop=5000%2C2813%2C0%2C260&resize=360']]

Text: ['Just Stop Oil’s tactics are “disastrous” and have “alienated” those who care about environmental issues, Ed Miliband has said.', 'The energy security secretary said although he understood the motivation of the protest group, he could not back its methods because they were “driving people away” from moving to net zero.', 'Miliband would not be drawn on the jailing of five Just Stop Oil activists for protests on the M25. However, on JSO more generally he told Good Morning Britain on ITV: “I think their tactics are disastrous in terms of persuading people to come to our cause. Because when you saw what happened in relation to some of those protests — people not being able to go about their business, people not being able to']
Author: ['Geraldine Scott']
Images_url: [['The jailing of five Just Stop Oil activists has provoked protest', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F5d46ca98-80b3-4a16-bbd2-a1d64140e68c.jpg?crop=3037%2C1708%2C0%2C152&resize=360']]

Text: ['Police have called on the residents of Troon to look out for criminal disruption and create a “network of vigilance” during the Open.', 'More than 200,000 golf fans are expected to descend on the Ayrshire town for the tournament which begins on Thursday. Specialist officers have urged those living and working in the community to become their eyes and ears during the event.', 'It is understood that they are particularly concerned about disruption being caused by members of Just Stop Oil. Members of the radical environmental group, which espouses non-violent direct action, brought last year’s tournament to a temporary halt when members coated a green with orange powder.', '“The 152nd Open will be one of the biggest events Ayrshire has ever hosted,” said Chief Superintendent']
Author: ['Marc Horne']
Images_url: [['Protesters have used tactics including covering a green with orange powder', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2Faf2e624c-7000-462e-bda8-823772545fbe.jpg?crop=4000%2C2874%2C0%2C0'], ['Just Stop Oil have targeted the golfing event two years in a row — including last year’s tournament in the Wirral', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F4d984b65-bbfd-4424-890f-46612c08640a.jpg?crop=5000%2C2813%2C0%2C261&resize=360']]

Text: ['Two Just Stop Oil activists have been found guilty of criminal damage after they threw tomato soup at a Van Gogh painting in the National Gallery and damaged its antique frame.', 'Phoebe Plummer and Anna Holland, both 22, threw two tins of Heinz tomato soup at Sunflowers and then glued themselves to the wall in October 2022.', 'Although the painting, which was completed in 1888 and is worth up to £72.5 million, was protected by a glass cover, the 17th-century Italian frame was damaged by the soup, which acted like paint stripper, Southwark crown court was told. Prosecutors believe the soup may have caused £10,000 in damage to the frame.', 'The pair, who denied damaging property, showed no emotion as the jury announced its']
Author: ['Ali Mitib']
Images_url: [['Phoebe Plummer, above, and Anna Holland, below, arriving at Southwark crown court on Thursday', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F48823791-85c0-4956-83e2-8912927908b6.jpg?crop=1530%2C1302%2C0%2C182'], [None, 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F0faf72ec-bf8d-48c4-a8d8-95b8f5fc64aa.jpg?crop=1321%2C1051%2C0%2C138']]

Text: ['Climate activists have been arrested after spraying orange paint over departure boards at Heathrow Terminal 5.', 'Two Just Stop Oil (JSO) protesters staged a sit-in protest at the terminal, the home of British Airways, after spraying windows, floors and screens orange.', 'JSO said that Phoebe Plummer, 22, and Jane Touil, 58, were responsible for the protest, that they had entered the terminal at 8.35am and police had arrived within minutes to cordon off the area.', 'The two women were taken away to waiting police vans by 8.50am. The Metropolitan Police said two people had been arrested on suspicion of criminal damage and that officers remained at the scene to “deal with any further offences”.', 'Plummer was one of two activists found guilty last week']
Author: ['Ben Clatworthy']
Images_url: [['The two women sprayed departure boards with orange paint before staging a brief sit-in protest', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2Fa7deac5e-4c9a-4133-8a0e-bf1d3de3d753.jpg?crop=3840%2C2160%2C0%2C0'], [None, 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F2d2b1ae1-7214-4022-ba04-aafab7e8f90d.jpg?crop=3000%2C1688%2C0%2C0']]

Text: ['To those who missed their flights, were unable to receive cancer treatment and could not attend family funerals, the antics of those who clambered up gantries or stood in the fast lane to bring traffic on the M25 to a halt for four days in 2022 were hardly “peaceful protest”; their criminal disruption affected the lives of thousands, cost the economy £765,000 and added more than £1 million to the Metropolitan Police bill.', 'In defiance of new laws to combat their inexcusable campaign to cause maximum damage and national outrage, the leaders of Just Stop Oil (JSO) planning the protest have now paid the price. And quite rightly. Roger Hallam, the founder of JSO and a serial protester who attempted to lecture the jury even']
Author: ['The Times Leading Articles']
Images_url: [['The Just Stop Oil co-founder Roger Hallam has been jailed for five years', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F44ec9ad7-29df-4759-b5e8-e5121218ffdd.jpg?crop=4822%2C3215%2C0%2C0'], ['author-image', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F6c2aac4b-45fc-43a1-b82d-3d3a84d1dfab.jpg?crop=3333%2C3333%2C0%2C0']]

Text: ['What would you say defines a cult leader? Charisma, prolixity, mania — many of them have these distinct, unsettling qualities. If you look at any extremist, though — any political headbanger, any messiah-like ruler — there’s one thing they all have. A complete, psychotic inability to understand what it is like to be another person, or even care. They may preach good for society, but they don’t take any interest in it, or even understand what it is. It is why they often prefer animals.', 'Take, for example, the Just Stop Oil convicts. How can they be so appalling?', 'Five of them were arrested in October; they’ve now been given huge sentences. One, Roger Hallam — a thin, grey, unlaundered man, half badger, half']
Author: ['Camilla Long']
Images_url: [['author-image', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2Fd0ce1993-5c50-42af-902b-ffdacc701641.png?crop=1000%2C1000%2C0%2C0']]

Text: ['Nine Just Stop Oil activists have been arrested at Heathrow during a summer “international uprising” by the environmental activist group.', 'The suspects were detained on Wednesday morning at two locations near the perimeter of the airport.', 'The Metropolitan Police said the activists were taken into custody on suspicion of conspiring to interfere with a site of key national infrastructure under the Public Order Act. Flights and other operations were not affected.', 'Video footage showed activists arriving on bicycles at a site close to passenger planes, outside a barbed wire fence, before an unmarked car pulled up and they were arrested.', 'A Just Stop Oil source told The Times last month that the group was planning a campaign to disrupt airports during the summer holidays as']
Author: ['Laurence Sleator']
Images_url: [['The protesters were arrested on suspicion of conspiring to interfere with a site of key national infrastructure, police said', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F8a4ea668-dc47-43f3-8bc4-a3b759c35d23.jpg?crop=3000%2C1688%2C0%2C453&resize=360']]

Text: ['A group of Just Stop Oil protesters who tried to stop passengers at Gatwick have been removed and arrested, the airport said.', 'Seven members of JSO, an environmental activist group, tried to block access to the south terminal’s central search area where passengers are screened. Video shared by the group showed passengers climbing over the protesters, who had painted orange boxes with them, to enter the security screening area.', 'Barriers were put up around the protesters and passengers were diverted through a different entrance before the group was removed. There has been no disruption to flights.', 'A spokesman for the airport said: “London Gatwick is open and operating normally today. There are a small number of protesters at the airport who have now been arrested']
Author: ['Ben Clatworthy']
Images_url: [['Despite the protesters’ efforts, passengers faced no delays and flights continued as scheduled', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2Fc3e16928-83d9-4f4e-bbe2-473f4192ba02.jpg?crop=3000%2C1688%2C0%2C155&resize=360']]

Text: ['Frankfurt airport, the busiest in Germany, suspended flights for three hours on Thursday morning after climate activists blocked runways by gluing themselves to the tarmac.', 'The Last Generation group said in a statement that six protesters had cut through a fence and had reached various points on the runways, carrying posters reading “oil kills”.', 'Photographs released by the group showed protesters in orange safety vests with their hands glued to the tarmac. They were later removed from the tarmac and arrested.', 'Flights resumed shortly before 8am local time, about three hours after the activists started their protests. About 140 of the 1,400 flights scheduled for Thursday had to be cancelled, the airport operator Fraport said. More delays are possible during the rest of the day.']
Author: ['David Crossland']
Images_url: [['A protester from Last Generation sits with his hand glued to a runway and sign saying “oil kills”', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F3a611b95-70cd-42ad-b72f-de2b84b7b09c.jpg?crop=2048%2C1152%2C0%2C0&resize=360']]

Text: ['Those who set themselves up for sainthood ought to be judged by harsher standards than the rest of us. In the case of the Extinction Rebellion co-founder Roger Hallam, sentenced last week to five years in prison after his involvement in a conspiracy to shut down one of our busier motorways, two standards can be applied.', 'To what extent is Hallam motivated by personal vanity — by a sense of himself as a bruised, flinty, oracular man with a ponytail telling British society hard truths; such hard truths, in fact, that its only response is not to listen to them but to bang him up in prison?', 'Second, do Hallam’s positions — that a global carbon elite is planning to kill billions of people, that']
Author: ['Will Lloyd']
Images_url: [['author-image', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F3c39ba0f-6614-4db5-b893-828585101138.jpg?crop=615%2C615%2C493%2C118']]

Text: ['A former chairman of the National Trust has described plans by climate activists to target National Trust estates over its use of Barclays as “virtue signalling”.', 'Climate activists will hold protests at more than 40 National Trust sites this week in an effort to stop the charity from banking with Barclays, over its links to the fossil fuel industry.', 'The organisers of the protests, which include staff, volunteers and members of the trust, said that they would not attempt to disrupt overall operations. Instead activists, who are backed by groups such as Extinction Rebellion, Fossil Free London and Christian Climate Action, will focus on creative acts of protest which range from picnics to parades and musical performances.', 'The actions come after Christian Aid and']
Author: ['Ali Mitib']
Images_url: [['Sir Simon Jenkins described protesters as “virtue signalling”', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2Fb727e1cd-e781-4f7b-abc8-52d95020726f.jpg?crop=5000%2C3333%2C0%2C0'], ['Corfe Castle in Dorset is one of the National Trust properties where protests are planned', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F3753c536-3443-41fc-93c4-6894a1491c5a.jpg?crop=5000%2C2813%2C0%2C260&resize=360']]

Text: ['In 2009, amid teargas, pepper spray and charging police, I learnt a truth about protest. I was embedded with the activists at the Copenhagen climate summit, and the Danish police were moving in to forcibly prevent us from marching on the conference hall. Minutes before that happened, though, one of the older climate demonstrators turned to me with a big grin. As I watched the Just Stop Oil protesters receiving their sentences recently, I thought of him.', 'He was experienced at all this. He had marched against nuclear weapons. He had marched, whenever required, against capitalism. He had probably met Swampy. Now, as the police closed the cordon and charged in one last time, as he dodged and weaved, he took hold of my shoulders.']
Author: ['Tom Whipple']
Images_url: [['author-image', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2Fe24ec05a-821f-4c94-a66a-3fc9133ec165.png?crop=300%2C300%2C0%2C0']]

Text: ['A political blog faces a landmark legal attempt to block it from view in the UK as part of a row prompted by a millionaire eco businessman and Labour donor.', 'Dale Vince, a former funder of the activist group Just Stop Oil, is suing the editor of the Guido Fawkes blog for defamation over its reports on comments the businessman made regarding the Israel-Gaza conflict.', 'Last October, Vince, 62, told Times Radio that “one man’s terrorist is another man’s freedom fighter” — a comment that triggered a barrage of criticism, including from Angela Rayner, who is now the deputy prime minister.', 'At the time, Vince was being interviewed at the Labour party conference in Liverpool in the immediate aftermath of Hamas’s attack on Israel and']
Author: ['Jonathan Ames', 'Alex Farber']
Images_url: [['Dale Vince, the owner of the energy company Ecotricity, made a comment about Hamas that triggered a barrage of criticism, including from Angela Rayner', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F58762ab0-64c8-4a99-889d-52370087b6ef.jpg?crop=4174%2C2347%2C0%2C141&resize=360']]

Text: ['Sir, Your leading article (“Be Prepared”, Jul 19) is right to welcome the recommendations from Baroness Hallett’s report on Covid preparedness. Her ten-point plan is a good framework for addressing the shortcomings exposed during the pandemic. However, many inquiry reports over the past two decades have similarly urged government to review crisis preparedness, and far too little has been done to ensure that lessons really are learnt.', 'Crises will happen, and not only pandemics, and they are by definition unpredictable; proper planning and preparedness is needed to mitigate their effects. Any crisis demands a speedy response based on tried and regularly tested systems. Decisions should then be made on the basis of best available scientific advice.', 'The recommendations from the Covid inquiry will']
Author: None
Images_url: [['author-image', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F91552403-0243-4147-ab1f-5795482ebddf.jpg?crop=595%2C595%2C0%2C0']]

Text: ['A theatre in Edinburgh has come under fire for hosting a comedian who supported the Baillie Gifford boycott — after the venue’s boss publicly criticised the protest.', 'David Greig, artistic director of The Royal Lyceum, expressed support for the investment firm’s sponsorship of Scottish book festivals during protests against its involvement with Scottish book festivals.', 'Activist groups targeted Baillie Gifford, demanding it should divest from literary festivals owing to its investment in fossil fuels and in tech companies that operate in Israel.', 'Kumar waded into the controversy when he and Charlotte Church pulled out of their appearances at Hay Festival in Wales.', 'The comedian shared a statement from Fossil Free Books, the group that led the protests, and wrote: “Sad to say that I will']
Author: ['Sian Bradley']
Images_url: [['Kumar waded into the controversy about arts funding when he pulled out of a gig at the Hay Festival', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2Fe7243986-2a15-4697-b90e-e565760f8e08.jpg?crop=4745%2C2669%2C55%2C243&resize=360']]

Text: ['Only one detective constable with wildlife crime expertise remains at the Metropolitan Police, in a blow for efforts to combat the illegal trade in ivory.', 'After the Met disbanded its long-standing and well-respected Wildlife Crime Unit (WCU) a fortnight ago, the naturalist Chris Packham led calls for the force to devote more resources to tackling abuse of wildlife.', 'The police team played a key role in tackling the smuggling of illegal animal parts and plants through Heathrow. Last year it seized thousands of items including snakeskins and live birds at the airport as part of Operation Thunder.', 'It also played a vital role in enforcing breaches of local wildlife laws, with the housebuilder Bellway Homes fined £600,000 for destroying a bat breeding site four years']
Author: ['Adam Vaughan']
Images_url: [['Seized ivory carvings and elephant tusks are displayed before being crushed', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2Fdf94534e-f9a3-4c40-a9fc-403ad1f00ed1.jpg?crop=4205%2C2365%2C0%2C25&resize=360']]

Text: ['Investigators are looking into an anonymous email apparently sent by a mysterious ultra-leftist group claiming responsibility for arson attacks on France’s rail network that caused transport chaos hours before the Paris Olympics opening ceremony.', 'The email was sent to French and international media organisations from an address with the domain name “rise up”. The domain name has been used by violent groups in France in the past, including ultra-leftists, anarchists and radical environmentalists, according to security sources.', 'However, Gérald Darmanin, the interior minister, said in an interview on Saturday that he could not rule out foreign involvement. He did not name any country but was apparently alluding to Russia, which has allegedly orchestrated arson attacks in several European countries including the UK.', 'Moscow has been']
Author: ['David Chazan']

Text: ['Sir, A fault in the software of one IT supplier has led to global chaos (news, Jul 20). In parallel, the first report of the Covid inquiry has identified inadequate healthcare data systems as a contributory factor in the mishandling of the pandemic, and Sir Ed Davey has given his account of the government’s involvement in the Horizon IT scandal (“Post Office bosses lied to me about IT glitches”, Jul 19). There is a common thread here. Pervasive and mission-critical software infrastructure has an increasingly wide-ranging societal impact, and must be made less vulnerable to the vagaries of opaque products that serve inadequately framed and governed interests. You also report on Mariana Mazzucato making the case for collaboration between the private']
Author: None

Text: ['Steve Reed Hi Rachel, lovely to see you in cabinet. Blue really suits you. Just wondering if you’re free for a budget chinwag. As secretary of state for environment, food and rural affairs, I’m hoping we can discuss my plans for environment, food and rural affairs? I know the £28 billion is probably still off the table, but these onshore wind farms don’t pay for themselves.', 'Rachel Reeves I thought that’s exactly what they did.', 'Reed Well, eventually, weather permitting, but still keen to discuss our bold green future.', 'Reeves I can do next Wednesday before PMQs.', 'Reed I’ll bring biscuits.', 'Louise Haigh Fifth female transport secretary paging first female chancellor! Ding ding! Just wondering if you’ve had a moment to think about my bus']
Author: ['Matt Rudd']
Images_url: [[None, 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F6c16e4c1-8594-4dee-817b-10eecc74a776.jpg?crop=1600%2C900%2C0%2C0&resize=360']]

Text: ['Liz Truss This is brill. I’m in the car outside the count and I can hear they’re already clapping for me. The man with the keys to the sports hall keeps gesturing for me to come in, but if there’s one thing I know other than economics, public speaking and global leadership, it’s stagecraft. You’ve got to keep the people waiting', 'Hugh O’Leary It’s on the TV now, darling. I’m afraid I think they’re slow-clapping you. You should probably go in', 'Truss They’re not slow-clapping me. It’s the Norfolk version of a drum roll. They love it when I drop in to their constituency. I’m going to let them savour the anticipation, then I’ll go in', '…', 'O’Leary Darling, is everything OK?', 'Truss That is']
Author: ['Matt Rudd']
Images_url: [[None, 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2Fa4e5f8c4-b8ba-4f4b-9606-4b2b9eae65d3.jpg?crop=1600%2C900%2C0%2C0&resize=360']]

Text: ['The deranged lengths to which professional golfers will pursue perfection should never be knowingly underestimated.', 'Viktor Hovland was in a phenomenal vein of form towards the end of last year when he won the season-ending Tour Championship and then headed to Rome. Once plagued by his short game, the Norwegian’s chip-in at the first hole on Friday morning set the tone for the Ryder Cup and a record-breaking 9&7 victory with Ludvig Aberg over Scottie Scheffler and Brooks Koepka in the foursomes the following day was essentially the death knell. “The way I’ve played over the last couple of months, I would say I believe I am [the best player in the world],” Hovland said — not unjustly — shortly after winning 3½ points.', 'But']
Author: ['Tom Kershaw']
Images_url: [['Hovland won the FedEx Cup last year but finished outside the top 18 in his first seven events this season after changing his swing', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2Fb154b116-af26-426e-9ac0-73861838d6fb.jpg?crop=2727%2C1534%2C18%2C412&resize=360']]

Text: ['The movie Thelma concerns a 93-year-old widow scammed out of her savings who seeks restitution, aided by her wastrel 24-year-old grandson, Danny.', 'It is a tender, hilarious and sweet (without being saccharine) depiction of the relationship between the very old and their young adult grandkids. Scenes where an endlessly patient Danny schools a frustrated Thelma in computer skills will resonate with many.', 'It is a paean to the courage of the old, determined to be masters of their destiny despite infuriating infirmities and the loneliness of outliving every friend. Thelma, played by June Squibb, reminds me of my mother: she may remind you of yours. Gen Zs like Danny are depicted as self-pitying, timorous and lost, yet redeemable if given a challenge.', '• Thelma review']
Author: ['Janice Turner']
Images_url: [['author-image', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F83ac89c7-941e-46b3-a10c-7772fb05b15e.png?crop=300%2C300%2C0%2C0']]

Text: ['In the end, perhaps it is an apt image for the whole election. The leader of the Liberal Democrats jumping head-first off a crane, hollering “vote Liberal Democrat!”, his ballooning paunch bouncing up and down on a bungee cord like a prop in a giant game of cup and ball. Here we are again, Britain, taking a leap into the dark, trying to upend the status quo for the third time in a decade (2016, 2019, 2024), only to find within a few years that we are once again spinning in circles, tethered to the same dock.', 'The previous votes for change were branded more colourfully. Boris Johnson as salesman offered the prospect of “unleashing potential” or “levelling up”, but such dangerous specificity has been']
Author: ['Juliet Samuel']

Text: ['Sir, William Hague concludes cogently that Joe Biden now has a final chance to demonstrate positive leadership for the future security of Europe and the free world (“Biden’s last act must be to strengthen Ukraine”, Jul 23). Biden’s disastrous decision to implement Donald Trump’s plan to withdraw US and Nato troops from Afghanistan in 2021 convinced Putin that the West was weak and poorly led. Twenty years of bloody struggle but positive social progress in Afghanistan was squandered in an instant, but now President Biden has the opportunity to show determination and leadership by untying the arm behind President Zelensky’s back and letting the Ukrainians use US long-range missiles to strike targets deep into Russia. Britain and Germany should follow suit. It is']

Text: ['Sir, As a recipient of the winter fuel allowance I applaud the chancellor’s decision to cancel the payment that would otherwise be arriving in my bank account in November solely because of my date of birth — another example of ageism (“Tax rise hints as chancellor cuts winter fuel payment”, Jul 30). But I hope the requisitioned winter fuel payments of people like me do not vanish into the £22 billion black hole. Instead they should be put into a winter warmth budget for the many thousands of people who will be dreading the winter, many of whom will be admitted to hospital with hypothermia, adding to the financial pressures on the NHS.Sir Muir GrayDirector, the Optimal Ageing Programme, Oxford', 'Sir, Without doubt']
Author: None

Text: ['Who could resist a peek behind the most famous net curtains in the country?', 'The rooms leading to the balcony of Buckingham Palace have always been off-limits to the general public.', 'The Royal family has traditionally preferred to wave down at them from a distance when it comes to the big balcony state occasions, but on Thursday, for the first time, visitors will have their own chance to see the balcony from the other side of those net curtains, as the East Wing opens for a trial period over the summer.', 'If youâ\x80\x99re not among the 6,000 royalists who have already snapped up all the tickets within six hours of them going on sale, or youâ\x80\x99d prefer not to pay Â£75 for the privilege, hereâ\x80\x99s what youâ\x80\x99re missing.', 'First: the unexpected volume of Chinese-themed bling. When the royal family retire from their public appearances on the balcony, it is not immediately obvious that they are stepping back inside the Orientalist fantasy of a dissolute reprobate.', 'History may have remembered the reckless and reviled Prince Regent, later George IV, as â\x80\x9ca bad son, a bad husband, a bad father, a bad subject, a bad monarch and a bad friendâ\x80\x9d but his appetite for laudanum and marrying women in secret was matched only by his enthusiasm for blowing a fortune on art and antiques. â\x80\x9cOrientalâ\x80\x9d art, in particular.', 'European imitations of Asian arts and crafts were all the rage during his Regency heyday and two centuries â\x80\x94 and one very expensive palace renovation â\x80\x94 later, Buckingham Palace is still groaning with it.', 'The East Wing is open to visitors following a five-year renovation as part of the â\x80\x9creservicingâ\x80\x9d of Buckingham Palace. The ten-year programme, which involves everything from rewiring the building to replacing old boilers and installing new lifts, is costing the Treasury Â£396 million.', 'Visitors will find a palace of two halves, a royal headquarters full of treasures which, depending on which red-carpeted corridor you take, can feel more like a conference centre that has seen better days. Think less Versailles, more that Bournemouth hotel where Roald Dahl set The Witches.', 'It was the sale of George IVâ\x80\x99s Royal Pavilion in Brighton that funded the construction of the famous palace faÃ§ade we know today. Queen Victoria wanted a new wing for her expanding family and once it was built, she filled it with art and furniture from her profligate uncleâ\x80\x99s seaside pleasure palace.', 'Today, George IVâ\x80\x99s extravagant stamp is still felt strongly throughout the newly refurbished rooms, from the huge pair of porcelain pagodas, brought back from the Far East by a shipâ\x80\x99s surgeon and which now stand at the mirrored end of the main corridor, to the absurdly camp palm tree curtain poles of the Yellow Drawing room, where the late Queen Elizabeth used to sit for official portraits.', 'A highlight of the tour will be entering the inner sanctum of the â\x80\x9cCentre Roomâ\x80\x9d where the royals gather before stepping out onto the balcony.', 'The first surprise is just how low the balustrade is. (Honestly, it is not much higher than knee-height and is the least child-friendly balcony Iâ\x80\x99ve ever seen. It is no surprise that visitors will not be allowed to step out onto it during tours; the risk of people toppling over the edge while taking selfies would be high.)', 'The second surprise is the Chinese theme that runs throughout the decor. They have really gone to town. Four huge tapestries, depicting caricatures of Asian figures, adorn the wall. Oriental vases stand between the double doors. A massive pink and green lotus flower chandelier which would not look out of place in a Disneyland hotel, dominates the room. And so it continues throughout the wing. Hand-painted wallpaper. Silk wall hangings. Gilt dragons. Lacquered cabinets.', 'I lost count of the fat Buddhas and â\x80\x9cChina manâ\x80\x9d ornaments which might be considered dangerously bad taste if encountered at a car boot sale anywhere else.', 'Itâ\x80\x99s a fascinating glimpse into the 19th-century fad for â\x80\x9cChinoiserieâ\x80\x9d but one wonders what visitors like the Emperor of Japan made of all the caricatured Asian figures adorning every other Buckingham Palace lamp base and fireplace, during his recent state visit.', 'A spokeswoman for the Royal Collection Trust said that the tour guides will be discussing the cultural baggage around these issues, as they lead small groups of 20 people around the rooms.', 'â\x80\x9cSome of the works on display in the East Wing reflect this fascination with East Asia, and its status as an emblem of taste â\x80\x94 even while revealing the limits of British understanding at the time,â\x80\x9d she said.', 'â\x80\x9cThe wardens will be providing some of this context when talking about the objects on display.â\x80\x9d', 'Ticket-holders will also be able to see the recently unveiled portrait of King Charles by Jonathan Yeo, as it commands centre stage in the ballroom.', 'Caroline de Guitaut, Surveyor of the Kingâ\x80\x99s Works of Art, said that visitors may be surprised to see â\x80\x9cthese works that speak very loudly of George IVâ\x80\x99s more exuberant and exotic tastes.â\x80\x9d', 'She added: â\x80\x9cIt was Prince Albertâ\x80\x99s idea to have a balcony at Buckingham Palace, because he saw it as a way of enabling the royal family to connect with the people, and of course thatâ\x80\x99s exactly how, in a sense, it continues to be used on important occasions.', 'â\x80\x9cBut it began to be used very early on in Queen Victoriaâ\x80\x99s reign, from 1851 waving off the troops to the Crimean War and welcoming them back on their return.â\x80\x9d', 'The King was said to have been instrumental in opening up the east wing for the first time and almost 6,000 tickets were sold out within hours of going on sale in April.', 'The reservicing is due to be completed by 2027.']
Author: ['Lucy Bannerman']
Images_url: [['An oriental theme runs through the decor', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F089425c7-17e8-44a0-8309-f7581bc8e804.jpg?crop=5000%2C3336%2C0%2C0'], ['The new potrait of King Charles by Jonathan Yeo is on display in the ballroom', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2Ffda340ed-15a2-46f7-8e83-800031317c4c.jpg?crop=5000%2C3337%2C0%2C0'], ['The East Wing, which leads onto the palace balcony, is opening to the public for the first time after lengthy preparations', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F8cae1a2e-705c-4b78-ac13-6cf51276e42c.jpg?crop=5000%2C2813%2C0%2C610&resize=360']]

Text: ['Catching up with some of the new Scottish Labour MPs in Westminster watering holes last week, the mood could perhaps be summed up as comfortably numb. They’re pleased, of course, deliriously so in many cases. But like people who have just won the lottery, they’re not entirely sure what to do with their good fortune and a little anxious that they might not deserve it.', 'This is not a bad thing. Politicians should be anxious to do well and not take their success for granted. They desperately need to avoid triumphalism and gloating, especially in the hearing of hacks like me. Margaret Thatcher’s deputy, Willie Whitelaw, famously remarked after a Labour setback: “Wrong to gloat. Mustn’t do it, no, no, no. But I can tell']
Author: ['Iain Macwhirter']
Images_url: [['author-image', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2Fd4f7e4ed-2e34-4598-9ff1-7c531b2f602b.png?crop=300%2C300%2C0%2C0']]

Text: ['Sir, It is sadly unsurprising to read the health secretary’s comment that the Care Quality Commission “is not fit for purpose” (“Hospitals have gone unchecked for 10 years”, Jul 26). As chair of the first regulator of the NHS, the Healthcare Commission, I began to introduce a system for measuring and improving performance in NHS trusts by relying on the collection, analysis and dissemination of relevant data, measured against robust standards. It rejected the Ofsted model of routine inspections/visits in favour of a targeted approach, and sought to wean the government away from single-word assessments. And it began to bear fruit, including revealing the crisis at Mid Staffs. Unfortunately, the commission was soon abolished, perhaps because it was providing too many uncomfortable truths']
Author: None
Images_url: [['author-image', 'https://www.thetimes.com/imageserver/image/%2Fmethode%2Ftimes%2Fprod%2Fweb%2Fbin%2F91552403-0243-4147-ab1f-5795482ebddf.jpg?crop=595%2C595%2C0%2C0']]

Text: ['Good day, dearest Times reader, and welcome to the week when England fans all seem irrevocably glum after Sunday’s match — something I must admit I do not understand. We came second in the whole tournament. Second! Guys, surely that’s … really good? Out of 24 countries, we were one from the top! We got silver! Surely there cannot be any reaction to this other than a hearty “Hurrah!”?', 'I am, of course, aware that no one other than me is going “Hurrah!” right now but I genuinely don’t understand why. Comparing like for like, Britain is consistently either the sixth or seventh largest economy in the world, yet we don’t end every G7 summit with people crying in the streets because, once again, we']
Author: ['Caitlin Moran']
